summary: The purpose of this article is to investigate the genetic relationships and diversity of USA500 methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) isolates from the U.S. Emerging Infections Program through whole-genome sequencing and phylogenetic analysis.

use_cases.case: The DNA sequence for Staphylococcus aureus 2395 plasmid, called pUSA500, was used by the authors to investigate the presence and origin of the toxicity-adjacent IS256 insertion site in other isolates from the C1 clade.
